verses.text: 撒母耳年老的時候，立了他的兒子作以色列人的士師。

words.note: Lit. 'Israel people'
Refers to the ancient Israelite leaders.

verses.text: 他的長子名叫約珥，次子名叫亞比亞，都在別是巴作士師。
兩個兒子都沒有行撒母耳的道路，反而轉去追求不義之財，收受賄賂，屈枉正直。

words.note: Often used in biblical contexts meaning 'to live according to'.
In biblical contexts, 'way' often refers to a moral or spiritual path.
Literally 'unrighteous wealth'.
Often used in legal or moral contexts.

verses.text: 於是以色列所有的長老都集合起來，到拉瑪去見撒母耳，

words.note: Refers to respected leaders, especially in the church or Israelite community.
Particle indicating the beginning or completion of an action, often a gathering.

verses.text: 對他說：「你老了，看哪，你的兒子不行你的道路，現在求你為我們立一個王治理我們，好像列國一樣。」

words.note: Indicates a change of state, 'become old'.
Often used in biblical texts to draw attention.
Often used in biblical contexts meaning 'to live according to'.
In biblical contexts, 'way' often refers to a moral or spiritual path.
Refers to the surrounding non-Israelite nations.

verses.text: 他們說「求你為我們立一個王治理我們」這件事，使撒母耳很不高興，他就禱告耶和華。

words.note: A verb-object compound meaning 'to pray'.

verses.text: 耶和華對撒母耳說：「眾民對你所說的一切，你只管聽從，因為他們不是厭棄你，而是厭棄我，不要我作他們的王。

words.note: Indicates the object of an action or something that is done.
Combines with 所 to form a nominalized phrase 'what is said'.

verses.text: 自從我把他們從埃及領上來的那天起，直到現在，他們怎樣離開我，事奉別的神，他們對我所行的一切，也照樣對你行。

words.note: Introduces the object of a verb.
Often used after a time word, e.g., '那天起' (since that day).
Indicates the object of an action or something that is done.
Combines with 所 to form a nominalized phrase 'what is done'.

verses.text: 現在你只管聽從他們的話，但必須鄭重警告他們，告訴他們那要統治他們的王要怎樣治理他們。」
於是，撒母耳把耶和華所講的一切話都告訴那些向他要求一個王的民眾，

words.note: Introduces the object of a verb.
Indicates the object of an action or something that is done.
Combines with 所 to form a nominalized phrase 'what is told'.

verses.text: 說：「那要統治你們的王將這樣治理你們：他必徵用你們的兒子，派他們作他的戰車兵、騎兵、在車前奔走的前鋒，
又派他們作千夫長、五十夫長，替他耕田、收他的莊稼、替他製造作戰的武器和戰車上的裝備。

words.note: Functions as a locative suffix here.

verses.text: 他必徵用你們的女兒作配香膏的、燒飯的和烤餅的。
他必奪去你們最好的田地、葡萄園和橄欖園，賜給自己的臣僕。

words.note: Common in formal or religious contexts.

verses.text: 你們撒種所得的和葡萄園所出的，他都徵收十分之一，賜給他的太監和臣僕。

words.note: Literary construction, nominalizing the verb '得'.
Literary construction, nominalizing the verb '出'.
Common in formal or religious contexts.

verses.text: 他又必徵收你們的僕婢、最精壯的青年和驢，替他工作。

words.note: To collect taxes, tribute, or conscript resources.
Refers to both male and female servants collectively.

verses.text: 你們的羊群，他要徵收十分之一；連你們自己也作他的奴僕。

words.note: To collect taxes, tribute, or conscript resources.
Literally 'one part of ten'.
Often used collectively for enslaved people or servants.

verses.text: 到時，你們必因你們為自己揀選的王而哀求，那時耶和華卻不應允你們。」

words.definition: at that time, when the time comes

words.note: To select deliberately, often implies discernment.
To make an earnest, sorrowful plea or supplication.
The Hebrew name for God.
To respond positively to a request or prayer.

verses.text: 眾民竟不肯聽從撒母耳的話，說：「不，我們要一個王治理我們，

words.note: Refers to the entire populace or assembly.
A prophet and judge in the Old Testament.

verses.text: 讓我們也像列國一樣，有自己的王治理我們，帥領我們出征，為我們作戰。」

words.note: Refers to the various nations or peoples.
To act as a general or leader in a military context.
To go forth to battle or for a military campaign.
To engage in military combat.

verses.text: 撒母耳聽了眾民的一切話，就向耶和華複述。

words.note: Indicates completion or change of state.
Connects sequential or causal actions.
To state again.

verses.text: 耶和華對撒母耳說：「你只管聽從他們的話，為他們立一個王。」於是撒母耳對以色列人說：「你們各人回自己的城去吧。」

words.note: Indicates the object of an action (e.g., 'speak to').
Emphasizes a straightforward or unconstrained action.
Lit. 'listen and follow'.
To set up or institute.
Indicates a sequence of events or a result.
Can also function as a directional complement.
Indicates suggestion, command, or agreement.
